messages.content: You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.

Hedera network explorers are tools for tracking activity on the Hedera network. They provide real-time data on transactions and offer a user-friendly interface for viewing and searching those transactions.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
Can you provide some examples of community-hosted network explorer services for the Hedera network?

Certainly! Here are some community-hosted network explorer services for the Hedera network: 1. [Arkhia Network Explorer](https://explorer.arkhia.io/#/mainnet/dashboard) 2. [DragonGlass Network Explorer](https://app.dragonglass.me/hedera/home) 3. [Hashscan Network Explorer](https://hashscan.io/) 4. [Hedera Explorer](https://hederaexplorer.io/) 5. [L-Works Network Explorer](https://explore.lworks.io/)
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
How can I search for a specific transaction using a network explorer?
To search for a specific transaction, you can use the unique transaction ID. The transaction ID should look something like this: `0.0.48750443@1671560120.085845879`
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
How can I create my own custom Hedera network explorer?

You can create your own custom Hedera network explorer using the Mirror Node REST APIs or take a look at the Hedera Mirror Node Explorer open-source project available at https://github.com/hashgraph/hedera-mirror-node-explorer
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
How can I add a network explorer to a specific page?

To add a network explorer to a specific page, refer to the contributing guide and open an issue in the `hedera-docs` repository at https://github.com/hashgraph/hedera-docs. Please include the network explorer name, link to the network explorer, and a high-resolution logo within the issue.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What is the format of entity IDs for searching on a network explorer?

You can search by the unique ID of the entity you are looking for. The entity ID format is `0.0.entityNumber`. For example, `0.0.2` is an account ID, and you can search for that account using that ID.
